text: Yes, actually what we did in the machine learning was so tedious, so painful. We have a small team and everybody works very hard and we encountered numerous of these strange problems such as a variability of features that we decided that we wanted to make this thing go away for many other researchers, which might be a surprise coming from a head of management because head of management is supposed to keep everything secret. But I'm not a pure head of management. I'm an educator, an author, as well as a head of management. So what we did is that we put together our process in a service called Better Ask Hall. H-A-L is the machine in 2001 Space Odyssey. So betterasthall.com that we just launched recently is an online machine learning service that allows you to just upload any features you like in a spreadsheet. All you need to do is a spreadsheet and it will do the training that we apply internally. It's random for us. Nothing for Python. It's not like we're giving up any secret sauce because everything is made with open source software, open source libraries. So it's totally transparent. Nothing that varies. But it will just greatly simplify the workflow of a typical machine learning pipeline for any researcher who even a programmer, they may not have the time to put together all these different pieces of machine learning. So that's what we are doing. And what we're actually excited about is to kind of launch this service for not only financial investors, but perhaps other data scientists.
